intro: Auriculardisia boquetensis, commonly known as the Bouquet's earleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
